title: Network Architect
description:
About Us

We are a team of Architects, Senior Data, Application, and System Engineers, recognized for our elite capabilities in guiding clients worldwide through their digital transformation, data modernization, and cloud migration journeys. Our focus, predominantly in the data space, extends into a comprehensive array of services, including network infrastructure projects which are pivotal for our client's success in today's digital economy.

The Role

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated CCIE Network Infrastructure Engineer to join our team on a contract basis. This is a unique opportunity to work with an elite group of professionals on cutting-edge projects. The role is fully remote, offering the flexibility to work from anywhere, designed for an individual ready to make an immediate impact.

Duration & Availability

* **Contract Length:** 6-12 months, full-time engagement
* **Start Date:** Within 2-3 weeks from the job posting, with a preference for near-immediate availability

Key Responsibilities

* Design, implement, and manage complex network infrastructure projects with a strong focus on Cisco Nexus series (9500, 9600, 9300) and Cisco ITD.
* Develop and maintain high-security network environments, incorporating Palo Alto firewalls and advanced load balancing techniques.
* Work closely with clients to architect and deploy network infrastructure that supports digital transformation, data warehouse modernization, and cloud migration initiatives.
* Lead projects with minimal oversight, demonstrating a strong ability to manage time, resources, and project deliverables.
* Collaborate with a team of elite Architects, Engineers, and Analysts to deliver high-quality, scalable solutions.

Requirements

* **Certification:** Current CCIE certification is mandatory.
* **Experience:** Proven experience with Cisco Nexus 9500, 9600, 9300 series, and Cisco ITD. Strong background in managing Palo Alto firewalls and load balancing within complex environments.
* **Skills:** Exceptional technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills. Ability to work effectively in a fully remote setting. Strong communication and leadership qualities, capable of guiding teams and leading projects to success.
* **Contract Type:** Open to 1099 or Corporate-to-Corporate arrangements.

Ideal Candidate

The ideal candidate is a forward-thinking leader, eager to take charge and drive projects forward. You are highly experienced, with a knack for staying ahead in your field, constantly seeking opportunities for growth and development. Your expertise enables you to navigate complex environments with ease, making you a valuable asset to any project.

Why Join Us?

Joining our team means being part of an organization that values innovation and leadership. We offer a dynamic work environment where your contributions will directly impact our success and the success of our clients. This role is an excellent opportunity to expand your skills, work on challenging projects, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry.

Pay: From $80.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 40 per week

* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

title: Solutions Architect
description:
**Funnel Leasing Inc.,** is hiring for a **Solutions Architect** that can '**work from anywhere' in the U.S.** As a **Solutions Architect**, you will play a crucial role in addressing customers' complex business challenges. You will be responsible for translating business requirements into scalable and sustainable technical solutions, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and industry best practices. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a highly cross-functional role at Funnel. Our Solutions team is our technical hub and trusty conduit between customer and company.


**Why Funnel?**  

We are a 'work from anywhere' in the U.S. SaaS company that centers our services on the renter experience. We develop amazing software that has revolutionized the #proptech industry. And did we mention we have an amazing team that is on #FunnelFire!? Oh, did we forget to tell you we have unlimited PTO, benefits that begin on your first day of employment, P.I.N.K. core values that ROCK, and our team puts the FUN in Funnel!


Employees may be eligible for various benefits. Generally, we provide employee access to:


* Health insurance
* Dental and Vision insurance
* Company paid Life/AD&D
* Long-term Disability insurance
* Short-term Disability insurance
* Term Life insurance
* Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
* Health Savings Account (HSA)
* Retirement Plan - 2% company match
* EAP


In addition to these benefits, we also offer


* Benefits effective on first date of employment
* Remote-first; work from anywhere within the US company culture
* Uncapped Discretionary Time off
* Sick Leave
* 13 paid holidays
* One time remote work stipend
* Employee recognition program
* Employee-led Groups (ELG's)


**Who is Funnel Leasing?**


Have you ever rented an apartment and wished the process could be better? At Funnel we do too. We know we need to make the process of renting an apartment as easy as purchasing socks on Amazon. We've created cloud-based marketing and leasing software that delivers the ultimate rental experience for everyone involved in the process. We're in the process of transforming the real estate industry through cutting-edge technology built, sold, and supported by the most passionate people you'll meet.


Click here (https://funnelleasing.com/) to learn more about Funnel and our innovative team members across the country.  



The **Solutions Architect I's** essential roles and responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:


* Collaborate closely with internal teams, including product, engineering, support, and finance, to ensure alignment and successful execution of customer initiatives.
* Independently develop and proactively provide account strategies significant to our clients supported by your knowledge of property management industry trends, emerging technologies, and applicable regulatory changes
* Be conversant in our clients' business needs and the industry. Develop a mastery and an ability to keep up with our rapidly changing tech capabilities.
* Deliver results autonomously with minimal direction or guidance
* Ability to navigate, influence, and communicate with poise to CxO/VP level and senior technical stakeholders (both internally/externally)
* Distill and translate highly technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders to drive intended outcomes
* Develop a deep understanding of Funnel Leasing's software solutions and become a trusted expert in our product offerings.
* Consult with Funnel customers to provide operating best practices that maximize the value they can achieve from Funnel's software.
* Maintain and cultivate strong client relationships, ensuring satisfaction and loyalty through proactive communication and attentive service.


**Culture**


* Create a culture of continuous improvement and learning for individual professional development
* Foster collaboration within team and across the company
* Performs other duties as assigned and modified at manager's discretion


**Education, Work Experience, Knowledge, and Certifications**


* 2+ years at a SaaS technology company
* Proven experience as a Solutions Architect or similar role
* Experience conceptualizing and documenting system and process flows within an API-based integration environment
* Experience overcoming technical or change management barriers through a consultative mindset
* Ability to deliver on complex projects with competing and nuanced priorities


*Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Funnel, we are committed to building a proptech company that is as diverse as the multifamily industry we serve, and that means to not only live our inclusivity, but also to support and encourage it among all society. If you are excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.*


**Travel**: <5%

title: AWS Solutions Architect - Fully Remote
description:
DLZP Group is looking for a talented hands-on AWS Solutions Architect to help advance our growing Cloud Services business. This is an excellent opportunity to join DLZP's world class technical teams, working with hard-working, motivated and creative engineers, while also developing your skills and furthering your career within an innovative focused leader of AWS technologies.  

  

You will demonstrate technical skills in software development and cloud architectures as well as customer facing skills at all levels of a customer organization. You should also be able to think thoughtfully about business, product, and technical challenges. As a member of the DLZP Solutions Architect team, you will act as a trusted adviser to our managed systems customers.  

  

**Responsibilities**  

  

* Analyze current technologies used within the company and determine ways to improve
* Document and monitor requirements needed to institute proposed updates
* Work closely with Information Technology professionals within the company to ensure the hardware is available for projects and working properly
* Propose and establish a framework for necessary contributions from various departments
* Account for possible project challenges on constraints including, risks, time, resources, and scope
* Work in collaboration with project management teams to successfully monitor the progress of initiatives
* Provide detailed specifications and diagrams for proposed solutions
* Define clear goals for all aspects of a project and manage their proper execution
* Provide the architectural guidance and recommendations necessary to promote successful engagements worldwide
* Assist customers with the definition of technical strategies that will enable them to migrate more of their systems onto the AWS platform
* Capture and share AWS best practice knowledge with our broader Solution Architect community
* Share customer feedback to internal product management and engineering teams to help drive the future of DLZP
* Work as the technical leader to provide the customer business and technical solutions
* Serve as a technical advisor for business application initiatives by participating in the evaluation, planning, design, and implementation of new applications

**Qualifications**  

  

* 3+ years of hands-on AWS implementation or consulting experience
* 3+ years in customer and/or partner-facing roles utilizing AWS
* 3+ years of experience with AWS development and architectural hands-on consulting experience
* Project management and leadership skills
* Experienced in developing IT and cloud infrastructure
* Current understanding of best practices regarding system security measures
* Knowledge of software engineering and design architecture
* BA/BS degree or related work experience required
* AWS Solutions Architect: Associate certification
* Ability to travel

**Additional Preferred Skills**  

  

* Hands-on experience with AWS services like; EC2, RDS, Elastic Container services, Load Balancers, Route 53, and Cloud Formation
* Positive outlook in meeting challenges and working to take initiative and produce results
* Understanding of business analysis techniques and processes
* Professional experience working with and analyzing computer hardware and software
* Knowledge of and experience working with operating systems
* Experience working with end-user or developer communities
* Experience working across internal and external organizations
* Experience on Orchestration tools like Ansible is a plus.
* Knowledgeable of the software development lifecycle and has the skills to handle the software development lifecycle independently.
* Ability to quickly learn new technology and applications
* Ability to write infrastructure as code and experience on Cloud Formation platform.
* Familiarity with Oracle products is a plus
* AWS Solutions Architect - Associate required, Professional certification preferred

**Must be a U.S. Citizen and U.S.-based.**  

  

**An Equal Opportunity Employer**  

This is a remote position.

title: Solutions Architect
description:
Amida Technology Solutions is a DC-based technology company focused on solutions for data interoperability, data utility, and data security. We create open-source solutions that collect, reconcile, transform, and standardize data for business intelligence, predictive analytics, decision support, and user transactions. We specialize in taking data from inception to impact.

Our team is comprised of creative, forward thinkers who are passionate about using cutting-edge technology to make a difference in people's lives and have a positive impact on our country. We offer an entrepreneurial, high-growth environment that values fresh ideas, candid conversations, and authentic teamwork.

Amida is looking for a **Solutions Architect** to join our team in **Washington DC** or a r**emote location**. As a Solutions Architect you will work with a dedicated team to help modernize the data architecture for a Federal agency. You will work closely with the stakeholders as well as other contractors to help modernize the agency's data infrastructure and governance process. This role will produce user-driven application interfaces and work to provide meaningful enhancements to complex processes through automation, the incorporation of best practices for data management, and development of modern, accessible system design.

**What You Will Do:**

* Embed with and eventually lead a team of UI/UX designers to implement intuitive and feature-rich application interfaces
* Apply the latest techniques and trends in UI/UX design to build bespoke user interfaces for Amida's customers
* Work with Amida's clients to gather user input, test prototype designs, elucidate requirements, and iterate on implementation patterns and user experience flows
* Translate design specifications to requirements and aide Amida's development teams in the implementation of user interface designs

**Required Skills:**

* Bachelor's Degree, certification or equivalent work experience in Software Development
* 10+ years of experience working on Software solutions
* 5+ years of experience working on enterprise applications
* 5+ years of experience producing HTML, CSS and JavaScript web application interfaces
* 5+ years experience in .Net and PowerBI development
* 5+ years of business, functional, and technical analysis to generate requirements.
* Strong communication skills, attention to detail, and drive to deliver best-in-class software products
* Ability to obtain a Public Trust security clearance

**Preferred Skills:**

* Familiarity with VA infrastructure and data sources
* Understanding of the unique design constraints of the United States Government (such as Section 508 Compliance)

Communication is the key to success at Amida. Our people are known for their can-do attitude and ability to work effectively with client teams. We pride ourselves on having a collegial, multidisciplinary team with diverse backgrounds and experience. Our best team members pay intense attention to detail in all aspects of their work, have a strong sense of initiative, and are willing to be opinionated about the best ways of doing things. A sense of humor is an asset at Amida.

We help solve the biggest challenges in data management. If you want to help essential organizations get their data right, we hope you'll forward your resume and let us know why this role appeals to you. We look forward to hearing from you.

Amida Technology Solutions is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We value diversity of ideas and people.

Job Type: Full-time

title: SOLUTIONS ARCHITECT
description:
Location: North Dallas or Santa Clara, CA

We are seeking an experienced Solutions Architect to join our team in deploying the next generation of Identity and Access Management technology – Continuous Adaptive Trust. As a Solutions Architect, you will be responsible for pre-sales designing, post-sales implementing, and integration of our passwordless and continuous authentication solutions. You will work closely with our sales, development, and project management teams to ensure that our solutions align with client requirements and industry best practices.


**Responsibilities**:


* Collaborate with sales teams to identify and understand client requirements and propose appropriate solutions within our client environments.
* Design and architect solutions, including hardware, software, and network components, that meet client needs and align with industry best practices.
* Develop detailed solution architecture documents, including system diagrams, network diagrams, and technical specifications.
* Provide guidance and oversight to development teams to ensure that solutions are implemented according to the agreed-upon architecture.
* Identify and mitigate risks associated with solution design and implementation.
* Communicate technical concepts and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry best practices, and recommend new technologies and methodologies to improve our solutions.


**Requirements:**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* Proven experience as a Solutions Architect, with a minimum of 5-10 years of mid-senior level experience in designing and implementing complex IT solutions.
* Strong understanding of Identity and Access Management, cloud-based architectures, and
* containerization technologies.
* Experience with various development frameworks.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Familiarity with Agile and Scrum methodologies.

title: Software Architect
description:
Summit currently has an open position for Software Architect. Summit Interconnect is a leading provider of advanced printed circuit boards (PCBs) and related solutions. Our mission is to empower innovation by delivering the highest quality, most reliable PCBs to our customers. We are driven by a set of core values that guide our decisions and actions every day, including Integrity, Quality, Collaboration, Innovation, and Customer Focus.


You will be part of an exceptional team of engineers where collaboration is highly valued, where innovation is something that happens every day, where taking risks is encouraged. You will face unique challenges and lead the development of exciting applications that target challenging PCB manufacturing problems.


We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Software Architect to join our dynamic team. As a software architect, you will play a pivotal role as one of the key technical leaders shaping the next generation IoT architecture for PCB manufacturing. Your expertise will be instrumental in driving innovation and efficiency within our manufacturing systems. In this dynamic role, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, contributing to the design, implementation, and optimization of cutting-edge solutions that enhance our operation.


As a strategic thinker, you will be responsible for architecting solutions, ensuring scalability, reliability, and security for a seamless integration into our manufacturing ecosystem. Your vision and technical acumen will guide the development of robust and scalable architectures, providing a foundation for future advancements in PCB manufacturing. You must be able to thrive and succeed in an entrepreneurial environment, and not be hindered by ambiguity or multiple competing priorities.

**Responsibilities:**

* Design, develop, and implement software solutions using modern technologies and best practices.
* Lead architectural discussions and decisions, considering scalability, reliability, security, and performance.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project scope.
* Architect, deploy, and manage applications on Azure, ensuring optimal performance and reliability.
* Data Warehouse design, development, support and data mining related to new and existing complex Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) routines.
* Design and optimize database schemas, queries, and indexes for maximum efficiency.
* Provide guidance and mentorship to development teams on software architecture and best practices.
* Evaluate and recommend new technologies, tools, and frameworks to improve development processes and productivity.
* Ensure compliance with coding standards, architectural principles, and industry best practices.
* Perform code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members.
* Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends to continuously improve technical expertise.

**Qualifications:*** Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, electrical/computer engineering or other relevant technical discipline.
* 5+ years of experience in software architecture, with a focus on designing scalable, distributed systems.
* Proven experience in Azure administration, including deploying, configuring, and managing cloud services.
* Demonstrated expertise in Data Warehouse design, development, and support, with a focus on designing and implementing complex Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) routines for both new and existing systems.
* Proven track record of successfully architecting and implementing data mining techniques to extract actionable insights from large datasets within a Data Warehouse environment.
* Strong understanding of data modeling concepts and techniques, with the ability to design efficient and scalable data schemas to support analytical and reporting requirements.
* Proficiency in utilizing ETL tools and technologies (e.g., Azure Data Factory, SSIS, Informatica) to build robust data pipelines for data integration and transformation.
* Strong understanding of database administration concepts, with proficiency in SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB, PostgreSQL).
* Solid understanding of software development methodologies, such as Agile or Scrum.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
* Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time efficiently in a fast-paced environment.

**Bonus Qualifications:*** Strong foundation in data structures, algorithms, RESTful APIs, and OO Design.
* Experience in full-stack development using Node.js, Nest.js, Next.js, and React.
* Relevant certifications (e.g., Azure certifications, AWS certifications).

**Working Conditions:** This is a remote role with the expectation of on-site/in-person collaboration with teammates and stakeholders for moments that matter and may require up to 10% travel. **Compensation/Benefits:** Summit offers a variety of health and benefit programs. Which include Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA plans, Hospital and Accident plans, Life Insurance, PTO, Matching 401K, and Paid Holidays. Benefits are effective 1st day of the month following date of hire.


Pay Range for this position is $130,000.00 - $150,000.00 annually based on experience.

  

Summit Interconnect is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

title: Software Architect
description:
Netchex is seeking a full-time **Software Architect**. The architecture team cultivates architectural knowledge to grow individual skills and create successful products across teams. Architectural knowledge includes understanding architectural characteristics, making architecture decisions, choosing design principles, and designing the structure of software and its supporting delivery technology. You will work closely with business leaders around the organization to understand goals and translate them to executable technology strategy. Similarly, they work closely with individual contributors on the technology team to understand current challenges, facilitate technology improvements, and foster knowledge.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Interacting with business leaders and product owners ad-hoc and through scheduled meetings
* Giving feedback on product PR FAQs
* Actively participating in weekly product meetings
* Actively participating in team roadmap reviews
* Attending company all-hands meetings
* Attending technology town-hall meetings
* Actively participating in sprint reviews
* Actively participating in engineering leadership meetings
* Reviewing currently project development through code review and ad-hoc delivery team meetings
* Actively participating in the SRE Guild
* Actively participating in the Security Guild
* Develop architectural strategy, vision, and roadmaps collaboratively with business leaders and delivery teams
* Communicate architectural strategy, vision, and roadmaps to the organization

* Monitor progress on architectural roadmap
* Host architecture katas
* Provide mentorship to engineers

* Facilitate solution discovery for the product team

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; Master's degree preferred.

* Proficiency in one or more programming languages, such as Java, C#, Python, or JavaScript.

* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think critically and analytically.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.

description:

The successful candidate will play a crucial role in our team, contributing to the creation and evolution of a cutting-edge IT environment. The Cloud Architect will be involved at the ground floor in making impactful design decisions that will reap benefits for years to come. This is a very hands-on position initially that could grow in a number of directions as our company grows and diversifies. As part of a 6 person Engineering team, and collaborating closely with a 5 person INFOSEC team, the right candidate will be able to mentor, and be mentored, alongside some of the best talent available.

title: Solution Architect
description:
Nextech Solutions is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Solutions Architect to join our team. The Solutions Architect will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing comprehensive technology solutions that align with our clients' strategic objectives. The successful candidate will possess in-depth knowledge of networking, virtualization, enterprise services, and automation methodologies.

Responsibilities:

* Collaborate with clients through engagement to thoroughly understand their business needs, technical requirements, and strategic goals.
* Foster effective communication to build a strong partnership with clients, ensuring a deep understanding of their unique challenges and opportunities.
* Develop and present tailored solutions by creating customized solutions that leverage networking, virtualization, enterprise services, and incorporate automation to address clients' specific requirements.
* Clearly articulate the proposed solutions, highlighting their alignment with client objectives and expected benefits.
* Design end-to-end technology solutions using architect comprehensive technology solutions with a focus on scalability, security, and performance and ensure that the designed solutions meet industry best practices and standards.
* Offer guidance and leadership throughout the entire project lifecycle, from conceptualization to implementation through collaboration with cross-functional teams, providing technical insights and ensuring cohesive and efficient project execution.
* Continuously monitor industry trends and emerging technologies in networking, virtualization, enterprise services, and automation methodologies.
* Develop, maintain and update detailed technical documentation, including architecture diagrams, system configurations, and best practices.
* Ensure documentation is accessible and comprehensible for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Plan and execute proof of concept (POC) testing to validate the feasibility and effectiveness of proposed solutions and adjust and refine solutions based on POC results and feedback.
* Assist in proposal development by contributing to the development of project proposals, statements of work, and cost estimates and providing technical insights and details that enhance the overall proposal quality.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. (Master’s degree preferred)
* Proven experience as a Solutions Architect with a strong background in networking, virtualization, enterprise services, and automation methodologies.
* In-depth understanding of industry-standard networking protocols and technologies, including but not limited to TCP/IP, VPNs, VLANs, SDN.
* Experience in designing and optimizing network architectures for performance, security, and scalability.
* Advanced knowledge and hands-on experience with virtualization technologies such as VMware, Hyper-V, and containerization platforms.
* Expertise in cloud platforms, including AWS, Azure, and GCP, with the ability to design, deploy, and optimize cloud-based solutions.
* Familiarity with serverless computing, microservices architecture, and hybrid cloud environments.
* Extensive experience with enterprise services such as Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, LDAP, and other directory services.
* Strong understanding of security services, including firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, and identity and access management.
* Proficient in automation methodologies to streamline and enhance IT processes.
* Hands-on experience with automation tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Terraform, and scripting languages like Python or PowerShell.
* Implementation of infrastructure-as-code (IaC) practices for efficient deployment and management of resources.
* Experience in implementing security policies, encryption methods, and identity management solutions.
* Familiarity with database systems and management, including SQL and NoSQL databases.
* Understanding of database optimization, replication, and data backup strategies.
* Skill in designing solutions that facilitate seamless integration and interoperability between different systems and platforms.
* Experience with middleware technologies and integration patterns.
* Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and analytically.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders effectively.
* Relevant certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP), or VMware Certified Professional (VCP) are a plus.
* Must be a United States citizen with active Secret clearance with the US Government. (Top Secret preferred)

title: Azure Solution Architect
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY**:  

  

Seeking a US based Azure Solution Architect to join us in  

  

The Azure Engineer will provide the engineering and second level of support for all Azure platform and related services. A successful candidate for this position will be able to demonstrate technical skills, proficiency with the design, implementation and support of Microsoft Azure Platform Services. Assess, design and support solutions on the Azure platform components.  

Architecture and engineering of Microsoft Azure, providing guidance and deep technical knowledge on various Azure architecture elements deployed in an Enterprise environment. Must be able to talk about Azure Platform Services across all organizational levels (Technical, PM's and Executives.)  

  

**Primary Job Responsibilities**:  

  

* Implement, support, and maintain customers' Azure environment.
* Writing assessment, design, migration, and operational support documents.
* Provide technical guidance to delivery teams during the course of managed services engagements
* Top tier escalation for critical errors in customer environments
* Technical deep dives and Root Cause Analysis
* Assist with the design and development of Continuant’s proprietary monitoring and remote management tools
* Manages, evaluates performance of, provides feedback to, coaches, and provides career guidance to Analyst and Consultant level team members

**Experience and Qualifications**:  

  

* Experience deploying, supporting and troubleshooting Azure infrastructure.
* Experience with migrating to Azure from on prem environments.
* Strong Azure Networking design and troubleshooting
* Experience deploying, supporting and troubleshooting Modern Authentication and Multi Factor Authentication (MFA)
* Experience Azure AD and Conditional Access
* Strong understanding of Azure Cloud Adoption Framework and how to implement.
* Strong understanding of Azure Well Architected Framework and how to implement.
* Strong understanding of Azure Management and Governance and how to implement.
* Experienced with the Microsoft Office 365 Security Center - deploying policies and other best practice configurations and reviewing message traces and audit logs.
* Excellent written, organizational, and verbal communication skills as well as collaboration skills. Able to convey technical concepts to individuals without prior technical knowledge or understanding of topics.
* Able to coordinate and collaborate with business application stakeholders and infrastructure teams to ensure successful upgrades, installations or integration activities.
* Ability to perform client testing, server patching and deployment assistance.
* Azure CLI and Powershell
* Container platforms and tools Kubernetes Docker Azure Kubernetes Service Azure Container Service.
* Azure Advanced Networking Azure Virtual Networks ExpressRoute Site to Site VPN NSG App Service Environment ASG UDR.
* Azure PAAS Services Security and Provisioning Azure API Management Policies Azure App Service Event Hubs Service Bus Cosmos DB Azure SQL.
* Identity Management Azure AD Azure AD B2C Open ID Connect.
* Azure Security Center Threat Detection Container Security tools
* Experience with Azure Sentinel Azure Log Analytics Operations Management Suite OMS SysDig Application Insights

 **Preferred Skills and Certifications:**  

  

* 3 – 5 years of relevant experience with specified infrastructure and IT technologies.
* A Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, computer engineering, management information systems, information technology or a similar field.
* An equivalent combination of education and experience may substitute for a degree.
* Certifications are a plus  

	+ AZ-900: Azure Fundamentals
* + MS-500: Microsoft 365 Security Administration
* + AZ-103: Microsoft Azure Administrator
* + AZ-500: Microsoft Azure Security Technologies
* + AZ-104: Microsoft Azure Administrator

  

  

This is a remote position.

description:

title: Pre Sales Solution Architect
description:
**Location: Australia**


**About CoreView**


CoreView is the #1 Microsoft 365 management platform for Enterprise customers and MSPs who are transforming the way they run their Microsoft 365 stack. CoreView delivers a unified approach to configuration management, delegated administration, and automated governance with capabilities far beyond native tools or point products. Organizations of all sizes choose CoreView to command their operations, optimize tasks, refine governance strategies, and empower their workforce. CoreView empowers organizations to achieve more with Microsoft 365.


**About Simeon Cloud (a CoreView company)**


As businesses around the globe began migrating to Microsoft 365 for their data, collaboration, and productivity tools, they needed to ensure consistency across their environments. That meant hundreds of engineering hours to manually establish and maintain configurations.  

They needed a new solution.  

Simeon Cloud is that solution. We began with the simple idea that every engineering hour that could be automated could be saved for something more important. By eliminating up to 75% of manual configuration work, Simeon Cloud empowers clients and MSPs to reallocate valuable engineering resources while improving security.


**Job Description**


Are you ready to be a part of a dynamic team reshaping the technology industry through innovation? Then you could be the perfect fit for the Pre-Sales Solution Architect (PSA) role, here at CoreView. As a pre-sales solution architect covering both CoreView and Simeon Cloud, there are no limits to your growth or potential. Come aboard to redefine technology in the cloud, shape your future, and be a part of something truly groundbreaking.


**Responsibilities**


* Provide support to the sales and channel team members during the sales motion.
	+ Your territory will cover APAC
	+ You may also be asked to cover opportunities in the Middle East.
	+ The sales motion will include new business, upsells, and cross-sells
* Client Needs Assessment: Collaborate with the sales and channel teams to understand clients’ unique challenges and requirements, conducting in-depth needs assessments. Our clients include commercial customers and Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and we are able to address each of their pains and challenges.
* Technical Presentations: Conduct compelling technical presentations and demonstrations to showcase how our solutions meet clients’ needs, with a focus on benefits and value.
* Deliver webinars and represent CoreView and Simeon Cloud at marketing events
* Deliver proof of value exercises for CoreView and trials for Simeon Cloud for opportunities in your territory
* Client Engagement: Build strong relationships with channel partners by acting as a trusted advisor and providing support as needed to ensure their success in the sale and/or implementation of our solutions. This could include SIs, VADs, VARs and MSPs.
* Product Expertise: Serve as a product expert, staying up to date with our SaaS offerings' latest’ features and capabilities and ensuring a deep understanding of how they benefit clients.
* RFP Responses: Contribute to RFP responses by providing detailed technical content and ensuring alignment with client specifications.
* Cost Estimations: Collaborate with the sales team to estimate the costs associated with implementing our solution.
* Competitive Analysis: Stay informed about the competitive landscape and provide insight into how our solutions compare in terms of features, pricing, and value.
* Technical Documentation: Create and maintain technical documentation, architectural diagrams, and other relevant materials to support the sales process.

**Requirements**


* Bachelor's degree or relevant experience
* Minimum of 3 years working experience as a Solutions Architect in a sales or pre-sales role in the SaaS industry.
* Strong technical expertise
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical solutions to non-technical people
* Proven experience in designing and presenting technical solutions to clients.
* Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively within a dynamic team environment as well as independently.
* Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Entra ID


**Desirable Skills**


* An understanding of hybrid Microsoft 365 environments (on-premise Active Directory)
* The ability to create scripts in PowerShell
* High level understanding of Azure DevOps


**Additional Notes**


* All Applicants will be required to take a pre-employment assessment for consideration.
* CoreView is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength that diversity brings to the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on gender, race/ethnicity, protected veteran status, disability, or other protected group status.

title: Solutions Architect, Enterprise Networking
description:
**THE ROLE: Solutions Architect, Enterprise Networking.**

**Experience: 3 + yrs**

**Location: Grand Rapids, MI, or Lansing, MI**

**Position: Fulltime**

**Job Summary:**

We are looking to add a skilled Enterprise Networking and/or Security focused Solutions Architect to join our team from either the Grand Rapids, MI or Lansing, MI areas.

As a member of the Pre-Sales Engineering Team, you will be responsible for meeting with Presidio’s customers, collecting requirements for business solutions related to network and security projects, and developing engineering solutions for sale to Presidio customers. A successful Solutions Architect (SA) should be able to present and explain various technologies to customers, guide them through requirements gathering, and formulate a solution consisting of hardware, software, licensing, and engineering services.

The ideal candidate will have knowledge and understanding of ENTERPRISE class solutions from leading providers of on-premise and cloud networking/security solutions. Successful candidates will have a solid grasp of network and security design principles based on industry best practices.

**Travel Requirements:**

In this role you will be expected to travel up to 25%. You can be based in either the Grand Rapids, MI or Lansing, MI areas.

**Job Responsibilities:**

Develop high-level technical solutions and present to customers (Hardware, Software, Licensing, Professional Services).

Collect business and technical requirements.

Complete end-to-end, full lifecycle security/network designs.

Drive whiteboard conversations.

Craft customer facing presentations.

Delivering technical presentations and product demonstrations.

Generate hardware configurations (BoM).

Write statements of work (SoW) and develop Professional Service pricing utilizing Presidio tools.

Ability to self-pace and self-set direction in a team environment to drive business.

Work with Account Executive/Extended Sales Teams to develop customer relationship and solutions and assist in overall sales process.

Maintain and develop technical and technology specific skill sets and certifications.

**Required Skills:** 

Expert-level knowledge and experience with design, implementation, and support of two or more of the following:

Complex routing and switching solutions (Cisco, Juniper, Arista, Aruba)

Complex wireless solutions (Cisco, Juniper, Aruba)

SDN solutions (Cisco SD-Access, Cisco ACI, VMware NSX, CloudVision)

SDWAN solutions from Cisco, VMware, Palo Alto, Fortinet, Silver Peak, etc.

Cloud security and networking (AWS, Azure, GCP)

Firewalls/VPNs (Cisco, Palo Alto, Fortinet)

Network Access Control (ISE, FortiNAC, Aruba ClearPass)

IDS/IPS solutions (Cisco, Palo Alto, Fortinet)

MDR Solutions (Presidio, Arctic Wolf, Rapid7)

Endpoint security (CrowdStrike, SentinelOne, Carbon Black)

Identity and Access Management solutions

Micro-segmentation solutions (Guardicore, Illumio, Cisco Secure Workload)

SASE/SSE (Zscaler, Netskope, Palo Alto)

Security and compliance frameworks such as NIST, PCI, and HIPAA

Load balancing solutions (F5, Netscaler)

Cybersecurity offerings such as vulnerability assessments, penetration tests, compliance, segmentation strategy, or Red Team/Purple Team.

**Additional Desired Skills:**

Technical certifications in the areas of Enterprise Networking, Security, and/or Cloud

Experience with office productivity software and diagramming software such as MS Visio or Lucidchart

Experience in a Value-Added Reseller (VAR) environment

**Education and Experience:** 

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience and/or military experience

3+ years of experience, which demonstrates a significant level of expertise in Enterprise Networking and/or Security solutions.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: Up to $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Experience:

* Solutions Architecture: 3 years (Required)
* Enterprise Networking: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Software Architect
description:
**Position Overview**  

Ensures IT capabilities are designed, built, and deployed using technology best practices while ensuring delivery cost-effectiveness and total ownership cost.  

Develop and own technology roadmaps emphasizing driving out complexity and ensuring the company can scale efficiently and effectively as it grows.  

Work with IT leaders and associates to define technology architectures to meet business needs.  

Defines and owns the technical vision for Secure Software Development Lifecycle (SSDLC) automation and related products with a cloud-first approach.

 **Responsibilities**  

* This position is primarily a “coding architect” position and management of a small team of software engineers.
* Conduct hands-on educational camps in automation and cloud deployment for various backgrounds in Global Technology.
* Manage online presence and documentation such as website, wikis, and roadmaps.
* Participate in yearly architecture gap analyses.
* Participate in defining architecture expectations and documentation to include responsible vendor management and business architecture where appropriate.
* Conduct solution reviews and Red Teams of new and existing solutions to provide prescriptions, recommendations, and suggestions for improvement.
* Participate in the Technology Architecture Leadership Council (TALC) and run a Special Interest Group (SIG).
* Working with other governance teams, provide technology governance across the enterprise.

  

**Requirements** **EDUCATION**


**Required:**  

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience

  

**Preferred:**  

Master’s degree and/or LOMA certification  

  

**EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:**


**Required:**

* 12+ years of development experience including automation
* Proficiency in multiple tools of the full stack covering frontend frameworks, databases and deployments
* Proficiency in modern programming languages (e.g. JavaScript, Groovy, Python)
* Proficiency in modern automation tools and frameworks (e.g. Jenkins, NPM, Gradle, PIP)
* Experience with containerization
* Experience with load testing
* Experience with relational/NoSQL databases
* Experience with AWS, GCP or other cloud provider
  


**Preferred:**

* MBA and/or master’s degree in technology related field
* Strong understanding of programming principles and patterns and comfortable mentoring others in Test-Driven Development, Object Oriented, and Functional programming languages.
* Proficiency in multiple tools of the full stack, including proficiency in containerization, serverless, UI and API frameworks, Relational and NoSQL databases, AWS and other cloud providers, and load testing.
* Advanced ability to solve complex problems, drawing upon creativity experience, and multiple sources of information including other experienced team members.

  

**Company Overview**  

About RGA:



Reinsurance Group of America, Incorporated (NYSE: RGA) is one of the largest global providers of life reinsurance, with offices around the world. RGA delivers expert solutions in individual life reinsurance, individual living benefits reinsurance, group reinsurance, financial solutions, facultative underwriting and product development. Our mission is to enhance our clients’ prosperity by supporting their financial and risk management capabilities.



Pay is based on a number of factors, including market, a candidate’s skills, and experience commensurate with a role, etc. salary range: $143,245 - $213,390 + bonus. In addition, RGA maintains a full range of health, retirement, and other employee benefits.

title: ERP Software Architect
description:
**Role**

ERP Software Architect

**Location**

Remote, but prefer candidates in Phoenix, AZ or Atlanta, GA

**Travel**

If not local to Phoenix or Atlanta, travel to those locations will be necessary on occasion.

**Management**

Individual Contributor.

**Reports to** 

Director of Integrations

**Employment Type**

Full-Time, W2, Direct Hire

**Benefits**

· Medical, Dental, Vision

· Company pays 100% for STD, LTD, and Life Ins

· 2-3 weeks PTO, 5 days Sick Time, Paid Holidays, and 2.5 floating holidays per quarter

· 401k with matching up to 4%, Stock Grants, Bonus

· Virtual Fitness Classes (Yoga, Meditation, and other fitness), community involvement, and social activities

· Training Programs

· Modern, dynamic, and great work environment.

**The Opportunity**

The ERP Software Architect will attain and maintain knowledge of Jira and ERP practices and processes. You’ll work with product managers to understand and build requirements for new product features and functionality. Work with developers to create development plans and accurate estimates to assist with scheduling. A major focus of this role will be on documentation in JIRA to hand off to the development team.

**The Company**

The world of payment processing is rapidly evolving, and businesses are looking for loyal and strategic partners to help them grow.

We are a Canadian fintech company accelerating the business of clients around the world. Our modular, flexible, and scalable technology allows leading companies to accept next-gen payments, offer all payout options and benefit from card issuing, banking, risk, and fraud management services. Connecting businesses to their customers in more than 200 markets, with local acquiring in 45+ markets, 150 currencies and more than 600 alternative payment methods, we provide the technology and insights for customers and partners to succeed locally and globally with one integration.

We live our core values, and we thrive on solving complex problems. We’re dedicated to continually improving our product and providing relentless customer service. We are always looking for exceptional talent to join us on the journey!

**Culture**

We are an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates collaboration and innovation and is committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. Our team is comprised of a wealth of talent, skill, and ambition. We believe that employees are happiest when they’re empowered to be their true, authentic selves. *So, please come as you are. We can’t wait to meet you.*

**Responsibilities** 

● Design overall architecture of product so there is parity between each of the product lines.

● Attain / Maintain knowledge of Jira.

● Attain/Maintain knowledge of ERP practices and processes.

● Company uses many ERPs. Sage, Dynamics, NetSuite, Acumatica, and SAP. Learn them all.

● Work with Product Manager to understand and build requirements for new product features and functionality. Requirements should consider customer upgrade path and ease of use.

● Get things documented in JIRA and hand them off to the development team to get it built.

● Work with development to create development plan and accurate estimates to assist in scheduling projects.

● Participate in planning and scheduling.

● Meet established targets and ensure the timely completion of multiple tasks and projects.

● Communicate effectively with team members to clarify requirements and functional design, technical details, testing requirements, general processing instructions, documentation recommendations, system limitations and other related information.

● Identify issues which may affect schedule and communicate this in a timely manner to minimize impact to schedule.

● Identify and communicate functional design flaws and oversights that impact overall productivity and product quality.

● May be asked to provide or assist with product presentations; both internal and external.

● Proactively research, analyze and communicate information relating to new ERP releases. This includes documenting and communicating any changes required for our product to achieve continued compatibility.

● Work independently with limited guidance from manager.

● Build relationships with other departments within the organization to promote collaboration and knowledge sharing.

**Qualifications, skills, and experience**

● REQUIRED - Extensive knowledge of AT LEAST ONE ERP (Sage / Acumatica / Dynamics / NetSuite / SAP… etc.)

● REQUIRED - Knowledge of development process pertaining to documentation of a concept into ERP flow then into stories for development.

● REQUIRED - Ability to document concepts and deliverables end to end.

● REQUIRED – Experience with various tools for story creation for development.

● REQUIRED - Ability to adapt to and learn new ERPs as required.

● Preferred – Experience documenting with JIRA. Big plus, but not required.

● Preferred – Developer skills are great to have, but not required.

● Preferred - Ability to conceptualize and implement changes or innovations which optimize program efficiency, database efficiency, maintainability, and overall product quality.

● Preferred - Ability to utilize Jira tools to accomplish story creation for development.

● Preferred - Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from managers, team members, customers, and the general public.

● Preferred - Excellent internal and external communication skills; both written and verbal.

● Preferred - Excellent organizational skills with attention to detail.

● Preferred - Ability to actively listen to ensure understanding of problems and issues.

● Preferred - Excellent planning, time management and multi-tasking skills.

**Miscellaneous** 

● There is no vaccine mandate in the office.

● Visa sponsorship is not available for this role.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $130,000.00 - $200,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Bonus opportunities
* Employee stock purchase plan
* Performance bonus
* Stock options

Experience level:

* 7 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* ERP Software Architect (non-developer): 5 years (Required)
* EXPERT level ERP software: 3 years (Required)
* Sage ERP: 2 years (Preferred)
* Acumatica ERP: 2 years (Preferred)
* Dynamics ERP: 2 years (Preferred)

title: Architect QA
description:
**Become an Outcoder as a QA ARCHITECT**


We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Software QA Architect to join our software development team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing comprehensive quality assurance strategies, developing detailed test plans, automating tests, managing QA tools, and leading the QA team in delivering high-quality software. The QA Architect will work closely with development teams and other stakeholders to ensure established quality standards are met.


**What you'll need to be successful:**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.
* Demonstrated experience as a Software QA Architect or in a similar role.
* Experience in designing and developing quality assurance strategies.
* Deep knowledge of agile software development methodologies and quality assurance processes.
* Experience in test automation using tools such as Selenium, Appium, JUnit, TestNG, etc.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to work as part of a team.
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to effectively solve problems


**Responsabilities:**

  

* Design comprehensive quality assurance strategies that address project requirements, customer needs, and industry standards.
* Develop detailed test plans covering all aspects of the software, including functionality, performance, security, and usability.
* Automate tests using appropriate tools and frameworks to improve testing efficiency and consistency.
* Manage QA tools, including test automation tools, defect management tools, and test management tools.
* Identify, record, and analyze software defects, collaborating with development teams to resolve issues in a timely and efficient manner.
* Act as a mentor to other QA team members, providing guidance and support in areas such as test design, test automation, and tool management.
* Continuously assess software quality throughout the development lifecycle, identifying areas for improvement and recommending corrective actions.


**About us:** EX² Outcoding is a premier solution provider of a broad range of outsourcing services, combining proven expertise in technology and project execution for companies searching for high-quality software development solutions. We specialize in delivering the best technical solution and enhancing that solution creatively by working closely with stakeholders to understand the business context

  

#LI-ERICK #LI-REMOTE

title: Solutions Architect
description:
**We Breathe Life Into Data**



At Komodo Health, our mission is to reduce the global burden of disease. And we believe that smarter use of data is essential to this mission. That's why we built the Healthcare Map — the industry's largest, most complete, precise view of the U.S. healthcare system — by combining de-identified, real-world patient data with innovative algorithms and decades of clinical experience. The Healthcare Map serves as our foundation for a powerful suite of software applications, helping us answer healthcare's most complex questions for our partners. Across the healthcare ecosystem, we're helping our clients unlock critical insights to track detailed patient behaviors and treatment patterns, identify gaps in care, address unmet patient needs, and reduce the global burden of disease.



As we pursue these goals, it remains essential to us that we stay grounded in our values: be awesome, seek growth, deliver "wow," and enjoy the ride. At Komodo, you will be joining a team of ambitious, supportive Dragons with diverse backgrounds but a shared passion to deliver on our mission to reduce the burden of disease — and enjoy the journey along the way.


**The Opportunity at Komodo Health**



In this role, you'll get the opportunity to design and architect solutions for customers. You will solve key business challenges to ensure that the customer's needs are met. You will partner with customers and internal team members to deliver high quality solutions.



Solution Architects use a broad skill set across design, build, soliciting feedback, and presenting design reviews to produce eloquent solutions from requirements definition through to execution.


**Looking back on your first 12 months at Komodo Health, you will have…**


* Defined and developed comprehensive solutions by coupling industry knowledge with technology understanding
* Navigated ideas from the whiteboard to polished business applications for our healthcare and life sciences customers
* Led detailed requirement gathering sessions with customers and worked with the Komodo delivery team to ensure a comprehensive list of requirements was documented
* Determined the overall solution design for customer projects, including all Salesforce components, data and application integration, and selection of third-party tools
* Led a team of configuration specialists and business analysts to create and document our solutions
* Led customers through design reviews to refine and iterate on the solution design
* Participated in customer training sessions and other implementation initiatives to contribute to overall project success across all deliverables
* Strategically built relationships with relevant customer sponsors and stakeholders within each project to actively identify and create future opportunities, references, and to develop a robust industry network for the organization
* Stayed current with business challenges clients are facing in relation to Commercial Operations, Medical or Patient Services areas, including new trends, market conditions, regulatory requirements, and the competitive landscape


**What you bring to Komodo Health:**


* Expertise in documenting current state business processes, identifying gaps/areas for improvements, simplifying complex processes, as well as making recommendations for future state processes and system designs.
* Ability to effectively design and configure a scalable solution to meet client business needs.
* You've led a functional and technical team through full Salesforce project lifecycles.
* Demonstrated proficiency defining business requirements, writing user stories, and providing detailed Salesforce system and functional designs.
* You can teach and collaborate with business analysts and configuration specialists to design solutions, document requirements, and own portions of the build.
* Excellent cross-team communication and collaboration skills
* You have professional experience in life sciences consulting ideally in pharmaceutical with exposure to Commercial Operations, Medical or Patient Services related projects.
* You have experience in working with IT infrastructure teams and designing multiple integrations including email, SMS, telephony, and master data management
* Biotech and pharmaceutical direct industry experience is also acceptable.

  



#LI-CT1 #LI-REMOTE

**Compensation at Komodo Health**



The pay range for each job posting reflects a minimum and maximum range of pay that we reasonably expect to pay across all U.S. locations and may span more than one career level. We carefully consider multiple business-related factors when determining compensation, including job-related skills, work experience, geographic work location, relevant training and certifications, business needs and market demands.

**The U.S. national starting annual base pay for this role is listed below. This position may be eligible for performance-based bonuses as determined in the Company's sole discretion and in accordance with a written agreement or plan.**


$94,800—$157,800 USD**Where You'll Work**



Komodo Health has a hybrid work model; we recognize the power of choice and importance of flexibility for the well-being of both our company and our individual Dragons. Roles may be completely remote based anywhere in the country listed, remote but based in a specific region, or local (commuting distance) to one of our hubs in San Francisco, New York City, or Chicago with remote work options.


**What We Offer**



This position will be eligible for company benefits in accordance with Company policy. We offer a competitive total rewards package including medical, dental and vision coverage along with a broad range of supplemental benefits including 401k Retirement Plan, prepaid legal assistance, and more. We also offer paid time off for vacation, sickness, holiday, and bereavement. We are pleased to be able to provide 100% company-paid life insurance and long-term disability insurance. This information is intended to be a general overview and may be modified by the Company due to business-related factors.


**Equal Opportunity Statement**



Komodo Health provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type with regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Solutions Architect, DoD
description:
At Synack, we create technology that unleashes the best cybersecurity talent to secure our digital world.



We protect leading global organizations by reducing companies' security risk and increasing their resistance to cyber attack. How do we do this? By utilizing the world's best and most trusted team of ethical hackers who test through our powerful and controlled platform to deliver real security without compromise.



Backed by top-tier venture capital firms including Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Microsoft, and Google Ventures, Synack's mission is to leverage global security talent coupled with advanced technology to help enterprises discover security vulnerabilities before they become business problems. Discover the possibilities at Synack!



As the Solutions Architect responsible for the DoD, you will partner with Synack Account Executives and Customer Success Leaders to drive acquisition of new logos and growth in existing accounts as part of the Public Sector team.



Sounds interesting? Keep reading...


**You**



You apply your technical knowledge of the security testing field and your product expertise to build appropriate solutions for prospects and expansion plans for existing clients. You have experience navigating complex accounts to understand explicit needs and align solutions that meet customer objectives. You enable winning proposals, contract bids, statements of work, and RFI/RFP responses.


**Here's what you'll do**


* Deliver comprehensive technical validation and planning, including:
+ Understanding the digital attack surface and value at risk
+ Performing hands on black and gray box surveys of applications and networks
+ Documenting and reporting survey findings with customers and internal stakeholders
+ Understanding the customers existing vulnerability and security testing programs, tools and methods, including Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) requirements and goals
+ Leverage your findings to create technical proposals and position successful account strategies that align with customer goals

* Support the Synack DoD business through executive level planning and execution of key account development and clear understanding of the DoD mission, directives and challenges
* Build & develop consultative relationships and support the alignment of the Synack field team to prospective and existing customer needs and objectives
* Craft and solution offerings to meet near and long term testing objectives with strong business acumen
* Partner with internal stakeholders to develop and execute key account development plans
* Educate and enable customers through an understanding of their testing options, outside of traditional support models
* Support Executive Business Reviews with customers to provide technical validation for recurring revenue and drive new business
* Support account strategy development and contribute to and leverage a team in execution
* Contribute to and tailor marketing materials, pricing strategies, feature needs, license models
* Consistently demonstrate strong product knowledge and deliver the Synack value proposition through customer conversations


**Here's what you'll need**


* 4+ years of proven experience with technical sales, Federal DoD
* Strong, hands-on technical background with a consultative approach
* Excellent business writing and presentation skills
* Ability to articulate issues and concerns to executives and product teams
* Knowledge of penetration testing methodologies, tools, and common requirements
* Experience with vulnerability management, risk management frameworks and associated business workflows
* Knowledge of cyber security requirements for large DoD enterprise environments and how to leverage partners to amplify a value proposition
* Understanding of a SaaS business model with demonstrated experience driving deals from top of funnel through deal execution
* DoD Secret clearance strongly preferred
* Relevant industry certifications a plus (e.g. Network+, Security+, CISA, CEH, CISSP)
* Compliance and audit familiarity a plus (SRG, STIG, NIST, PCI)
* Candidates must be US citizens


**Ready to join us?**



Synack is committed to embracing diversity. Our people are our strength. Each addition to our team is an opportunity to grow and diversify our ideas, experiences, and viewpoints. We strive to be inclusive of Race, Ethnicity, Religion, Sex, LGBTQ+, Veterans, Disabilities, and Age. Synack welcomes you!



As a candidate, Synack cares about your privacy. Please view our candidate privacy policy here.


**$200,000 - $240,000** Salary is determined by a combination of factors including location, level, relevant experience, and skills. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. The compensation package for this position may also include equity, and benefits.
  

  

For more details about our benefits, please see here. Then for the Employer code, enter: **synack**

title: Solution Architect
description:
**Job Summary**  

We are seeking a skilled Solution Architect to join our team. As a solutions architect on our team, you'll translate your customer’s IT needs and future goals into a plan by crafting architecture products, design specifications, statements of work, requirements, and scripts. Through your leadership, we’ll help transform the way our client uses technology, including cloud migration, integrating advanced technology, and modernizing legacy systems. What do you do next in a career where you’ve reached this level? You mentor the next set of developers to help them grow into tomorrow’s solutions architects. Join us and build the future of technology and protect a critical federal financial agency's mission for the better.  

  

**Requirements**  

* 10+ years of experience with solution architecture, particularly in architecting, designing, and implementing both Enterprise and Cloud based (SaaS, IaaS, PaaS) application implementation
* 10+ years of experience working with business partners to define and understand business needs that help drive system design
* 5 + years of experience with leading system architecture and engineering involving the integration of COTS, GOTS, and FOSS software solutions, cloud, infrastructure, data architecture, and cybersecurity
* Experience with designing cloud-ready, independent applications and systems using open-source products
* Knowledge of Architectural Modeling, Data Modeling, Software Infrastructure, IT standards, Platform Architecture, Technical risk management, IT Strategic Planning, Software Architecture, or IT Policies
* Knowledge of Cloud technologies, including AWS or Azure
* Knowledge of Data Management Analytics Platforms/technologies (e.g., AWS Redshift, Palantir)
* Ability to develop functional and technical architecture diagrams, presentations, analysis of alternatives and documentation.
* Ability to analyze portfolio and domain business needs, research possible solutions, and define solution implementation approach
* Ability to integrate technical and functional considerations into comprehensive software designs and proposal documentation
* Ability to articulate best practices around the EA function with a focus on emerging cloud, data, analytics technologies
* Bachelor’s degree

  

**Nice to Have:**  

* Experience providing architecture-related support to the large federal agencies
* Experience with EA methodologies/frameworks and Industry best practices on architecture development
* Experience architecting cloud-based enterprise solutions
* Experience with cloud-based technologies and processes supporting Enterprise Portfolio systems (e.g., Agency Customer Experience systems, Tax Administration, Case Management, and Internal Operations Systems)
* Knowledge of IT Security compliance specifications (HIPAA, FISMA, NIST 800-53, FedRAMP)
* Knowledge of certification and accreditation processes for enterprise government solutions
* Applicable Industry certifications in Architecture Frameworks (e.g., TOGAF, FEAF)

  

This is a remote position.

description:

title: Software Architect
description:
**Software Architect**


**Reports To:** Director of Platform Engineering


**Employment Type:** Full Time, **FSLA Status:** Exempt, **EEO Category:** Professionals


**The Impact you Will Have:**

As a Software Architect you will play a critical role by collaborating closely with team members and product owners to architect and build product solutions, starting with the new Crucial Learning Platform. You will be responsible for a Headless Content Management System architecture, content model and it’s integration into the Crucial Learning Platform. You will partner with another architect to lead the software engineers on the team to ensure they fulfill technical, operational, and business requirements. You will partner with the other architect to ensure a successful CI/CD environment, ensuring high standards for security, scalability and resilience are met within AWS, coordinating with the SDETs in overall quality assessment and partner with product management leadership in major launches. You will report to the Director of Platform Engineering.


**What You’ll Do:**

* Design and maintain the Headless Content Management System, content model specifications and design the integration into the API.
* Work with the Product team to plan and architect new product and platform solutions.
* Participate in designing, implementing, and maintaining relevant product and platform integrations for operational infrastructure including enterprise data integration.
* Solve complex problems using knowledge, passion, and curiosity.
* Help build and deliver world-class cloud-based products.
* Apply industry standard best practices for secure coding, application development, services configuration, management, and deployment within AWS.
* Drive robust, maintainable, and scalable software across our product architecture and platforms.
* Drive an excellent end-user experience, continually raising the bar on functionality, usability, and simplicity.
* Develop simple, elegant, resilient, and elastic infrastructure that anticipates rapid growth and iteration.
* Ensure a high-level of quality development is conducted on your team by their performing thorough testing and leveraging peer reviews for their work and the work of cross functional teams.


**What You’ll Need:**

* Minimum of 10 years of hands-on software product development experience (preferably SaaS) including a minimum of 7 years of experience with analysis, design, and programming in a multi-product software development organization.
* Extensive experience with architectural design using Headless Content Management Systems
* Extensive experience with data model design in Headless Content Management Systems
* Extensive experience with integration of Headless Content Management Systems with API and web sites
* Extensive experience in successful development and deployment of cloud-based solutions, full-stack competencies, elastic and resilient microservices.
* Must have significant experience with JVM & Javascript polyglot and Spring. Preferred experience with projects involving identity, relationship, and permissions management.
* Extensive experience with AWS (or similar cloud) Technologies: ECS, EC2, Elasticache, S3, Route53, Secret Manager, CodeBuild, CloudFormation, Cloud Watch, IAM
* Experience driving technical projects, prioritizing work, identifying dependencies, facilitating technical decision, driving quality, reviewing user stories, and managing remote teams.
* Broad experience in relational and document databases, data structure composition, caching and reporting (with data lake / data mesh / BI experience a plus). MongoDB experience preferred.
* Extensive experience with continuous integration and automated build tools technologies with Maven and Gradle
* Preferred strong experience with solutions leveraging webRTC, WebSockets, learning technologies (eg SCORM, LTI, etc), xAPI, PWA
* Experience with creating technical diagrams, designs, documentation.
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field
* Experience with communicating technology to non-technical people.
* Solid written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong leadership and interpersonal skills with accompanying experience in successfully leading and mentoring a team of software engineers.
* Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future


**What You’ll Get:**


* Access to some of the richest professional development programs.
* A variety of benefits. Programs include health benefits, life insurance, income protection and retirement savings plan with employer contributions to assist with your health & financial security today and in the years ahead.
* Access to health benefits and wellness programs for employees and families.
* The ability to work in a flexible work environment.
* Professional development support as we want YOU to be successful in your career. Our team will work with you to establish the goals you are trying to achieve in your profession.


**The Process:**

The first step is to apply to the role. If your experience matches our needs, you will be reached out to by a member of the HR team to set up a call to learn more about you. From there, you can expect to meet with the hiring manager and some other members of the team. We like to connect over the phone, via Zoom and sometimes, in person (when applicable)!


**AAP:**


Crucial Learning provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Crucial Learning complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.


Crucial Learning expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Crucial Learning’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

title: Senior Solution Architect
description:
*E2open is the connected supply chain platform that enables the world's* *largest companies to transform the way they* *make, move, and sell goods and services. We connect more than 400,000 partners as one multi-enterprise network. Powered by the network, data, and applications, our SaaS platform anticipates disruptions and* *opportunities to help companies improve efficiency,* *reduce waste, and operate sustainably. Our employees around the world are focused* *on delivering enduring value for our clients.*

**Senior Solution Architect**

* Customer facing role to gather and define business requirements, design & document the planning solutions.
* Deliver best solutions to drive maximum value for customers on both application and technical front.
	+ Understand client's requirements and provide best practice solution options.

* Maintains direct communication between the customer, project director, project team and other global e2open associates as required

* Contributes significantly to the growth of the functional consulting practice by developing / maintaining practice aids, databases, best-practice collateral.

* Contributes significantly to the growth of the functional consulting practice by developing / maintaining practice aids, databases, best-practice collateral.

* Coordination with global Project Manager & Customers
